explanations.machine learning: The paper uses PCA and BP neural network for financial risk early warning, which are machine learning techniques.
explanations.supervised learning: The study involves training models (PCA-BPNN, SVM, Logistic) on labeled financial data to predict financial risk, which is a supervised learning task.
explanations.classification: The financial risk early warning model categorizes companies into risk levels, which is a classification problem.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper compares the performance of PCA-BPNN with SVM, indicating the use of support vector machines in the study.
explanations.SVM: SVM is explicitly mentioned as one of the compared methods in the financial risk early warning model.
explanations.principal components analysis: PCA is used to process financial data before feeding it into the BP neural network, indicating the use of principal components analysis.
explanations.neural network: The paper employs a BP neural network (BPNN) as part of the financial risk early warning model.
explanations.backpropagation: BP stands for backpropagation, which is the learning algorithm used in the neural network mentioned in the paper.
explanations.BP: BP neural network is explicitly mentioned in the title and abstract, referring to backpropagation neural network.
